docblock.description: Updates the busy flag of the machine.

Performs the search on the database

docblock.long-description: Adds a condition based on the attributes of the machine itself to the query. This function cannot be used for matching modules or module elements.

tag.name: return
tag.description: true if the condition could be added to the search; false on error

docblock.long-description: Adds another table to the SQL query

tag.name: param
tag.description: Name of the table to add

tag.name: param
tag.description: SQL condition used to perform the join

tag.name: return
tag.description: true on success; false otherwise

docblock.long-description:
Adds a filter implemented in PHP. As these filters require the database to read out all rows in the first place because the filtering is done by PHP code, these filters are not as efficient as SQL conditions.

Whenever possible choose a SQL condition instead.
Filters for machines whose ID is in the given array

tag.description: Array of the IDs of all machines to find

tag.description: Text to search for

docblock.long-description: Defined a PHP filter for machine searches. You cannot use Filter itself, instead use its subclasses.

tag.description: Kevin Wolf <kwolf@suse.de>

tag.name: param
tag.description: Machine to be checked

tag.name: return
tag.description: true if the given machine matches the filter; false otherwise

tag.name: param
tag.description: ('=' or 'LIKE')

docblock.description: Logs the user out of the application.
docblock.long-description: Destroys the current sesion if the user is logged in. It will not do anything if the user is not logged in.

parse_markers.error: No page-level DocBlock was found in file Authenticator.php

docblock.description: This file contains some function to access the parameters passed to the script via the $_REQUEST array.
docblock.long-description:
These functions should be used in favor of directly accessing the $_REQUEST array or the other superglobals like $_POST and $_GET.

Their main advantage is that 1) they check if the parameter exists 2) they make sure the parameter is of the expected data type

tag.name: param
tag.description: Name of the request parameter to get

tag.name: return
tag.description: The requested parameter as string or an empty string if the parameter is not present.

tag.name: param
tag.description: Name of the request parameter to get

tag.name: return
tag.description: The requested parameter as integer or 0 if the parameter is not present.

tag.name: param
tag.description: Name of the request parameter to get

tag.name: return
tag.description: The requested parameter as array or an empty array if the parameter is not present. Note that if there is a single parameter identified by $varname, an array containing this parameter as the only element will be returned. (This is how a PHP typecast to array works)

tag.name: todo
tag.description: Check for the expected structure provided by an extra parameter

tag.name: param
tag.description: Name of the request parameter to check

tag.name: return
tag.description: true if the request parameter is set and is an array, false otherwise

docblock.long-description: Returns a filter operator ('=' or 'LIKE') specified by a request parameter. Valid operator names are 'equals' and 'like'.

tag.name: param
tag.description: Name of the request parameter to get

tag.name: return
tag.description: A constant whose name matches the parameter, or null if no matching constant is found.
